questions: Q. 1. Why are brown algae brown?
answers: Ans. The pigments responsible for brown colour are xanthophyll and fucoxanthin.

questions: Q. 2. Name the substance that fixes the brown algae to the substrate.  (KVS2017)
answers: Ans. Algin.

questions: Q. 3. What type of organisms have been included in kingdom plantae?
answers: Ans. Kingdom plantae includes all the multicellular, photosynthetic producers of the biosphere,

questions: Q. 4. What are algae?
answers: Ans. Algae are plants with a thallus body which is not divided into root, stem and leaves. They are generally autotrophs,

questions: Q. 5. Name a red algae inhabiting fresh water.
answers: Ans. Batrachospermum,

questions: Q. 6. Which pigments are responsible for red colour of red algae?
answers: Ans. The pigments responsible for red colour of red algae are phycobilins, phycoerythrin and phycocyanin.

questions: Q. 7. Name a unicellular algae and the algae which reproduce sexually by conjugation.
answers: Ans. Unicellular algae is Chlamydomonas. Algae that reproduce sexually by conjugation is Spirogyra.

questions: Q. 8. When palmella stage is formed in algae?
answers: Ans. Palmella stage is formed in response to desiccation condition and toxic salts.

questions: Q. 9. Name an algae which is used in laboratory culture media.
answers: Ans. Gelidium ‚Äì Agar.

questions: Q. 10. Name a parasitic red alga and an alga responsible for the disease red rust of tea and coffee plant.
answers: Ans. Parasitic red alga ‚Äì Harocyella. Alga responsible for red rust of tea and coffee ‚Äì Cephaleuros.

questions: Q. 11. why are some bryophytes called liverworts?
answers: Ans. Some bryophytes are called as liverworts because their gametophyte resembles with liver lobes.

questions: Q. 12. What are rhizoids?
answers: Ans. Rhizoids are slender, unicellular or multicellular hair like structures which penetrate in the moist soil and absorbs the water for the plants.

questions: Q. 13. Name the bryophyte in which sporogonium is embedded in the thallus.
answers: Ans. Riccia.

questions: Q. 14. Define protonema stage.
answers: Ans. A juvenile autotrophic filamentous stage of mosses is called protonema.

questions: Q. 15. What are tracheophytes?
answers: Ans. Tracheophytes are the plants having vascular tissues.

questions: Q. 16. Which types of plants are kept under the division thallophyta?
answers: Ans. They include primitive forms of plant life showing a simple plant body.

questions: Q. 17. What are phycocolloids?
answers: Ans. Mucopolysaceharides over the cellulosic cell wall of brown algae such as agar, carrageenin, alginates etc, are known as phycocollolds.

questions: Q. 18. Name scedless vascular plants.
answers: Ans. Pteridophytes.

questions: Q. 19. Define a sporophylI.
answers: Ans. Leaves which bear spores on them are called as sporophylIs.

questions: Q. 20. Which group of plants is called vascular cryptogams?
answers: Ans. Pterdophytes are called as vascular cryptogams.

questions: Q. 21. Name the food stored in red alga.
answers: Ans. The stored food in red alga is Floridean starch

questions: Q. 22. From which algae does bromine is obtained?
answers: Ans. Bromine is obtained from Rhodomela.

questions: Q. 23. What is apophysis?
answers: Ans. Lower part of moss capsule is known asapophysis,

questions: Q. 24. What is Algin?
answers: Ans. Algin is a kind of complex sugar found in brown algae.

questions: Q. 25. Write the economic importance of moss plant.
answers: Ans. The moss Sphagnum absorbs water and is theretor used for keeping cut plant parts moist.

questions: Q. 26. Name the female sex organ in red algae.
answers: Ans. Carpogonium is the female sex organ in red alge.

questions: Q. 27. What is peristome?
answers: Ans. A structure consisting of curved teeth in the capsule of Funaria is termed as peristome.

questions: Q. 28. What is rhizome?
answers: Ans. In fems, the underground stem is called as rhizome.

questions: Q. 29. What are cone bearing plants called?
answers: Ans. The cone bearing plants are called Gymnosperm.

questions: Q. 30. What is an endosperm?
answers: Ans. A tissue which stores food in seeds and surrounds the embryo is known as endosperm.

questions: Q. 31. Name one tallest and one smallest angiosperm.
answers: Ans. (i) Tallest angiosperm - Eucalyptus regnans. (ii) Smallest angiosperm- Wolffia arrhiza.

questions: Q. 32. What do you understand by siphonogamy?
answers: Ans. It is a mode of pollination in which pollen tubes develop to facilitate the passage of male cells to eggs.

questions: Q. 33. What is an ovule?
answers: Ans. Ovule is an integumented megasporangium. It forms female gametophyte internally and after fertilization ripens to form a seed.

questions: Q. 34. What are epiphytes?
answers: Ans. A plant which grows on other plant but synthesizes its own food are termed as epiphytes.

questions: Q. 35. What is polyembryony?
answers: Ans. The phenomenon of occurrence of several embryos within one seed is known as polyembryony. ùëí. ùëî., citrus fruits.

questions: Q. 36. Give an example of unisexual angiospermic plant.
answers: Ans. (i) Mirabilis jalapa (4' O clock plant) (i) Cucurbita maxima (Kaddu).

questions: Q. 37. Name the different whorls of a flower.
answers: Ans. The different whorls of a flower are: (i) Calyx  (ii) Corolla  (iii) Androecium  (iv) Gynoecium

questions: Q. 38. Name a wild gymnosperm.
answers: Ans. Cycas circinalis.

questions: Q. 39. What term is used for life cycle having diploid dominant phase and gametophytic phase represented by few cells? (KVS 2013)
answers: Ans. Diplontic life cycle.
